verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; set to Shoshannim. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. Maschil. A Song of loves. My heart <WH3820> overfloweth <WH7370> with a goodly <WH2896> matter <WH1697>; I speak <WH559> the things which I have made <WH4639> touching the king <WH4428>: My tongue <WH3956> is the pen <WH5842> of a ready <WH4106> writer <WH5608>.
Thou art fairer <WH3302> than the children <WH1121> of men <WH120>; Grace <WH2580> is poured <WH3332> into thy lips <WH8193>: Therefore God <WH430> hath blessed <WH1288> thee for ever <WH5769>.
Gird <WH2296> thy sword <WH2719> upon thy thigh <WH3409>, O mighty <WH1368> one <WH1935>, Thy glory and thy majesty <WH1926>.

And in thy majesty <WH1926> ride <WH7392> on prosperously <WH6743>, Because <WH1697> of truth <WH571> and meekness <WH6037> and righteousness <WH6664>: And thy right hand <WH3225> shall teach <WH3384> thee terrible things <WH3372>.
Thine arrows <WH2671> are sharp <WH8150>; The peoples <WH5971> fall <WH5307> under thee <WH3820>; They are in the heart of the king <WH4428>'s enemies <WH341>.
Thy throne <WH3678>, O God <WH430>, is for ever <WH5769> and ever <WH5703>: A sceptre <WH7626> of equity <WH4334> is the sceptre <WH7626> of thy kingdom <WH4438>.

Thou hast loved <WH157> righteousness <WH6664>, and hated <WH8130> wickedness <WH7562>: Therefore God <WH430>, thy God <WH430>, hath anointed <WH4886> thee With the oil <WH8081> of gladness <WH8342> above thy fellows <WH2270>.
All thy garments <WH899> smell of myrrh <WH4753>, and aloes <WH174>, and cassia <WH7102>; Out of ivory <WH8127> palaces <WH1964> stringed <WH4482> instruments have made thee glad <WH8055>.
Kings <WH4428>' daughters <WH1323> are among thy honorable women <WH3368>: At thy right hand <WH3225> doth stand <WH5324> the queen <WH7694> in gold <WH3800> of Ophir <WH211>.
Hearken <WH8085>, O daughter <WH1323>, and consider <WH7200>, and incline <WH5186> thine ear <WH241>; Forget <WH7911> also thine own people <WH5971>, and thy father <WH1>'s house <WH1004>:
So will the king <WH4428> desire <WH183> thy beauty <WH3308>; For he is thy lord <WH113>; And reverence thou him <WH7812>.
And the daughter <WH1323> of Tyre <WH6865> shall be there with a gift <WH4503>; The rich <WH6223> among the people <WH5971> shall entreat <WH2470> thy favor <WH6440>.
The king <WH4428>'s daughter <WH1323> within <WH6441> the palace is all glorious <WH3520>: Her clothing <WH3830> is inwrought <WH4865> with gold <WH2091>.
She shall be led <WH2986> unto the king <WH4428> in broidered work <WH7553>: The virgins <WH1330> her companions <WH7464> that follow <WH310> her Shall be brought unto thee <WH935>.
With gladness <WH8057> and rejoicing <WH1524> shall they be led <WH2986>: They shall enter <WH935> into the king <WH4428>'s palace <WH1964>.
Instead of thy fathers <WH1> shall be thy children <WH1121>, Whom thou shalt make <WH7896> princes <WH8269> in all the earth <WH776>.
I will make thy name <WH8034> to be remembered <WH2142> in all <WH1755> generations <WH1755>: Therefore shall the peoples <WH5971> give thee thanks <WH3034> for ever <WH5769> and ever <WH5769>.
